title: Tournament Setup - Valid Size and Filter Selection
description: Verify that the user can select tournament size and dietary filters correctly on the Tournament Setup screen and proceed without errors.

steps.description: Navigate to Tournament Setup screen
Select a valid tournament size (e.g., 8, 16, 32)
Apply one or more dietary filters (e.g., vegetarian, gluten-free)
Click the 'Start Tournament' or equivalent button
Verify no errors occur and the Tournament Game screen loads with filtered food items

title: Tournament Setup - Invalid or No Tournament Size Selected
description: Ensure the system handles cases when no tournament size or an invalid size is selected and prevents proceeding.

steps.description: Navigate to Tournament Setup screen
Do not select any tournament size or select an invalid size (if possible)
Attempt to start the tournament
Verify appropriate error messages or validation prevents proceeding to Tournament Game screen

title: Tournament Setup - Dietary Filters Affect Food Items Correctly
description: Validate that applying dietary filters limits the tournament food items to only those matching the selected filters.

steps.description: Navigate to Tournament Setup screen
Select a tournament size
Apply specific dietary filters (e.g., vegetarian)
Start the tournament
Verify all foods in the tournament meet the dietary filter criteria

title: Tournament Game - Correct Pairings and Animated Battles
description: Ensure that the bracket displays correct pairings and that food battles are animated smoothly without glitches.

steps.description: Start a tournament with known size and food items
Verify initial bracket pairs correspond correctly to selected tournament size and filters
Proceed through multiple rounds of the tournament
Verify that battles animate smoothly and results update bracket correctly with no rendering glitches

title: Tournament Game - Support for Edge Case Tournament Sizes
description: Verify tournament supports edge case sizes such as the minimum (e.g., 2) and maximum (e.g., 100+) without errors.

steps.description: Set tournament size to minimum (2) and start the tournament
Verify the tournament runs without errors
Set tournament size to maximum (e.g., 128 or closest supported) and start the tournament
Verify the tournament processes correctly with no performance or UI issues

title: Result Screen - Display Winner Details from Contentful CMS
description: Check that the Result Screen loads winner's detailed recipe, history, and sensory map data correctly from Contentful CMS after tournament completion.

steps.description: Complete a tournament to reach the Result Screen
Verify winner's image, recipe, history, and sensory maps display with data fetched live from Contentful CMS

title: Result Screen - Handle Missing Contentful Data Gracefully
description: Verify fallback UI is shown when Contentful CMS data for the winner is unavailable or API call fails.

steps.description: Simulate Contentful API failure or missing data for winner
Complete a tournament and load Result Screen
Verify fallback content is displayed instead of missing data and no unhandled error is visible

title: Result Screen - Confetti Animation Triggers Only on Tournament Completion
description: Validate that confetti animation triggers only on tournament completion and winner display, not during gameplay or navigation.

steps.description: Navigate through tournament battles without completing tournament
Verify confetti does not trigger during ongoing battles
Complete tournament to reach Result Screen
Verify confetti animation triggers once winner is displayed

title: Dark Theme UI Styling Across All Screens
description: Ensure that all UI elements across Tournament Setup, Game, and Result screens adhere to the dark theme styling with no styling inconsistencies.

steps.description: Navigate through Tournament Setup, Tournament Game, and Result screens
Verify all screens apply dark theme styling uniformly and no light or inconsistent elements appear

title: Deep Linking to Result Screen Loads Correct Winner Data
description: Verify that navigating directly to a deep link URL (e.g., /result/FoodName) loads the correct winner's data consistently and correctly.

steps.description: Enter a deep link URL for a known food winner (e.g., /result/MeatPie)
Verify the Result Screen loads with correct winner details from Contentful CMS

title: Responsive and Accessible UI Elements
description: Test UI responsiveness and accessibility across different screen sizes and verify UI components have appropriate accessibility attributes.

steps.description: Open the application in various screen sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop)
Verify UI elements adjust layout correctly with no overflow or clipping
Use accessibility tools or keyboard navigation through screens
Verify all interactive elements are accessible with meaningful labels and focus states

title: Static Food Data - Load and Display Properly in Tournament
description: Confirm that the static data of 100+ Australian food items load correctly and display with correct images and metadata in tournament battles.

steps.description: Start a tournament without any dietary filters
Verify that food items appear with appropriate images and metadata from the static dataset
